intro: Sicyos bogotensis, commonly known as the Bogotá prickly pear, is a species of cactus native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its spiny stems and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, adapting to high-altitude conditions. Its leaves are reduced to spines, and it produces edible fruits that are sometimes used in local cuisines. Sicyos bogotensis plays a role in its ecosystem by providing food and shelter for various desert animals.
